verses.text: Whoso loveth instruction loveth knowledge: But he that hateth reproof \add is\add* brutish.
A good \add man\add* obtaineth favour of the \sc Lord\sc*: But a man of wicked devices will he condemn.
A man shall not be established by wickedness: But the root of the righteous shall not be moved.
A virtuous woman \add is\add* a crown to her husband: But she that maketh ashamed \add is\add* as rottenness in his bones.
The thoughts of the righteous \add are\add* right: \add But\add* the counsels of the wicked \add are\add* deceit.
The words of the wicked \add are\add* to lie in wait \add for\add* blood: But the mouth of the upright shall deliver them.
The wicked \add are\add* overthrown, and \add are\add* not: But the house of the righteous shall stand.
A man shall be commended according to his wisdom: But he that is of a perverse heart shall be despised.
\add He that is\add* despised, and hath a servant, \add is\add* better Than he that honoureth himself, and lacketh bread.
A righteous \add man\add* regardeth the life of his beast: But the tender mercies of the wicked \add are\add* cruel.
He that tilleth his land shall be satisfied \add with\add* bread: But he that followeth vain \add persons is\add* void of understanding.
The wicked desireth the net of evil \add men:\add* But the root of the righteous yieldeth \add fruit\add*.
The wicked is snared by the transgression of \add his\add* lips: But the just shall come out of trouble.
A man shall be satisfied \add with\add* good by the fruit of \add his\add* mouth: And the recompence of a man’s hands shall be rendered unto him.
The way of a fool \add is\add* right in his own eyes: But he that hearkeneth unto counsel \add is\add* wise.
A fool’s wrath is presently known: But a prudent \add man\add* covereth shame.
\add He that\add* speaketh truth sheweth forth righteousness: But a false witness deceit.
There is that speaketh like the piercings of a sword: But the tongue of the wise \add is\add* health.
The lip of truth shall be established for ever: But a lying tongue \add is\add* but for a moment.
Deceit \add is\add* in the heart of them that imagine evil: But to the counsellers of peace \add is\add* joy.
There shall no evil happen to the just: But the wicked shall be filled \add with\add* mischief.
Lying lips \add are\add* abomination to the \sc Lord\sc*: But they that deal truly \add are\add* his delight.
A prudent man concealeth knowledge: But the heart of fools proclaimeth foolishness.
The hand of the diligent shall bear rule: But the slothful shall be under tribute.
Heaviness in the heart of man maketh it stoop: But a good word maketh it glad.
The righteous \add is\add* more excellent than his neighbour: But the way of the wicked seduceth them.
The slothful \add man\add* roasteth not that which he took in hunting: But the substance of a diligent man \add is\add* precious.
In the way of righteousness \add is\add* life; And \add in\add* the pathway \add thereof there is\add* no death.
